author: Jack Davis
title: Trump Says Waterboarding ‘Absolutely’ Works, But He’ll Let Cabinet Decide Whether To Reinstate It
text:
“I’m going with General Mattis. I’m going with my secretary,” he said. “Because I think Pompeo’s going to be phenomenal. I’m going to go with that they say.” 
Trump said he believes Mattis and Pompeo will make the right decisions. 
“I will rely on Pompeo and Mattis and my group. And if they don’t want to do, that’s fine. If they do want to do, then I will work toward that end. I want to do everything within the bounds of what you’re allowed to do legally.” 
Mattis said in his confirmation hearing he opposed the use of torture. Pompeo made a similar comment, but noted in a later written response that he would be open to changes in the rules for interrogating suspects. He did not define what those changes might be. 
President Barack Obama signed an executive order in 2009 banning waterboarding — a form of simulated drowning — and other harsh interrogation techniques denounced as torture. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
